Name: Task Delay Example
Description: An example alias called 'example-delay' that allows you to schedule commands to run in the future.
Author: Rhien

AliasList.Command: #example;#task-add -s 1 -c "#echo {g={G>{x This is an example of scheduling commands to run.";#task-add -s 3 -c "#echo {g={G>{x You may use the {c#task-add{x command to schedule a task to run in a given amount of seconds.";#task-add -s 6 -c "#echo {g={G>{x If you wish to clear all pending tasks use the {c#task-clear{x command.";#task-add -s 9 -c "#echo {g={G>{x If you wish to see all of the tasks scheduled and the times they'll run use {c#task-list{x.;#task-add -s 9 -c "#echo {g={G>{x  I'll add two more tasks and run {c#task-list{x for you to see that.";#task-add -s 14 -c "#echo This is delayed task {y1{x.";#task-add -s 16 -c "#echo This is delayed task {y2{x.  This example is now complete.";#task-add -s 10 -c "#task-list"
